data.title: Dr. Seuss Enterprises
data.meta_description: Here to help spread the love of reading and the joy of smiling to children around the world.
data.text:
Global kidâs entertainment company Dr. Seuss Enterprises has promoted Nicole Gates from Senior Corporate Counsel to Vice President, Legal and hired Mike Lancaster to serve as Corporate Counsel. Gates will report directly to Susan Brandt, CEO and President of Dr. Seuss Enterprises, and Lancaster will report directly to Gates.

In her new role, Gates will manage the Dr. Seuss Enterprises legal team and provide strategic guidance on major corporate initiatives and operational matters. She will oversee all legal matters concerning the companyâs portfolio, including Dr. Seuss books, television programs, films, stage productions, digital media, exhibitions, licensed merchandise, and other partnerships. Gates will also administer global trademark and copyright portfolios, including trademark maintenance, intellectual property conflicts, and strategic filing projects. Prior to joining the company, Gates held positions at global law firms in California.

âI look forward to deepening and expanding all aspects of the licensing business that promotes and protects the beloved and iconic property,â Gates says.

In his new role as Corporate Counsel, Lancaster will advise on commercial contract matters and provide counsel on day-to-day legal matters, including those arising from strategic partnerships, vendor relationships, and promotional marketing initiatives. He will also focus on drafting and negotiating licensing contracts with publishers, content creators, media and entertainment companies, and retailers. Lancaster recently focused on corporate and complex commercial financing transactions in his role at an international law firm.

âIâm eager to join the Dr. Seuss Enterprises team and incorporate my broad experience into the incredible work this well-regarded property is doing,â Lancaster says.

âIâve had the pleasure of working alongside Nicole for over five years now, and I cannot overstate what an incredible asset she is to Dr. Seuss Enterprisesâ executive team as well as to the company as a whole,â Brandt says. âAdditionally, Mikeâs years of industry experience will make him a valuable addition to the team. As the legal department develops, so does the Dr. Seuss brandâs strength and impact across the globe.â

DR. SEUSS ENTERPRISES CELEBRATES ICONIC AUTHORâS BIRTHDAY BY PLEDGING TO GIFT A BOOK TO EVERY BABY BORN IN THE U.S. ON MARCH 2, 2024

Leading Global Entertainment Company Encourages Teachers and Parents to âRead Today for Their Tomorrowâ with One-of-a-Kind Pledge

February 15, 2024 â Over the decades Dr. Seussâs Birthday has become a national staple in classrooms and homes with millions of children, educators, and parents dressing up as their favorite Dr. Seuss character, picking up their favorite book, and celebrating the joy of reading. Today Dr. Seuss Enterprises announced they are honoring this storied legacy with a groundbreaking pledge: They are pledging to give away a free, personalized copy of the cherished book, The Cat in the Hat to every baby born in the U.S. on March 2, 2024. New parents can visit SeussPledge.com to register and claim their babyâs free book.

Books donated for the pledge will be supplied by Dr. Seussâs long-time publishing partner Random House Childrenâs books. The interior of each book will include a personalized message that commemorates the childâs Seussian birthday and encourages parents to read to their child every day to help ensure their tomorrows are filled with curiosity, imagination, and knowledge.

Susan Brandt, CEO & President of Dr. Seuss Enterprises, stated, âHelping ensure all children have easy access to books and literacy programs has always been one of Dr. Seussâs core missions. This pledge is an opportunity for us to honor this storied legacy and call attention to this noble cause. We canât wait to ship these personalized books out to these special newborns and connect them to a love of reading at a young age. The more books we can get into the hands of children, the more young readers we'll inspire to go great places.â

Dr. Seuss Enterprises is also providing free resources and activities for teachers and parents to celebrate Dr. Seussâs Birthday and the joy of reading in the classroom and at home with free downloads at Seussville.com.

ABOUT DR. SEUSS ENTERPRISES

Founded in 1993, Dr. Seuss Enterprises is a leading global childrenâs entertainment and licensing company focused on promoting literacy, education, self-confidence and the wonderful possibilities of a childâs imagination through the beloved works of Dr. Seuss. All Dr. Seuss Enterprisesâ profits benefit charitable organizations that focus on causes such as education, health, animal conservation, and the arts. For more information visit DrSeussEnterprises.com or follow us on Instagram.

â

Dr. Seuss-Themed Book Reading Events Featuring NFL Players to Take Place on Dr. Seussâs Birthday, March 2nd at Schools Across the Country

Participating NFL Teams Include Kansas City Chiefs, Detroit Lions, Chicago Bears, Tennessee Titans, Houston Texans, and Miami Dolphins.

February 27, 2023â Dr. Seuss Enterprises and Creative Minds Publications, announced today that they have teamed up with the NFL for the 7th annual Tackle Reading event on March 2nd in celebration of Dr. Seussâs 119th birthday. This year, the two organizations will bring NFL teams into schools across the country for special Dr. Seuss-themed events featuring a reading of a Dr. Seuss book by an NFL player and other celebratory activities. The NFL teams participating in this yearâs events include Kansas City Chiefs, Detroit Lions, Chicago Bears, Tennessee Titans, Houston Texans, and Miami Dolphins.

Tackle Reading events are assembly-style celebrations designed to inspire children at underserved schools to fall in love with reading. At each of the events a current or alumnus NFL player will read a beloved Dr. Seuss book at a school-wide assembly. As part of the event, students will have the opportunity to hear motivational messages directly from the NFL athletes and ask them questions. Every school will receive a collection of Random House Childrenâs Books titles, each student will receive a Dr. Seuss book from Random House Children's Books and Dr. Seuss school supplies from GEDDES, and every teacher will receive a Dr. Seuss t-shirt from Life is Good and a Cat in the Hat-style hat from Fun.com. The event will also feature other fun elements such as NFL team mascots, cheerleaders, and more.

Kathryn Starke, Founder of Creative Minds Publications, said, âWeâre looking forward to teaming up with Dr. Seuss Enterprises for this yearâs Tackle Reading event. We hope the combination of beloved Dr. Seuss stories and the playersâ enthusiasm will inspire even more kids at these schools to learn to love reading.â

Susan Brandt, President and CEO of Dr. Seuss Enterprises, said, âOne of our key missions at Dr. Seuss Enterprises is to work with community leaders to support literacy development efforts in underserved schools. What Kathryn Starke and the NFL have created is truly a selfless, inspiring program, and weâre thrilled to be a part of it as we celebrate Dr. Seussâs Birthday this year.â

This year marks the 7th annual Tackle Reading event produced by Creative Minds Publications. Over the past six years, the organization has partnered with athletes representing all 32 NFL teams and Hall of Fame members including Roger Staubach, Charles Haley, Drew Pearson, Willie Lanier, and Coach Mike Munchak.

About Dr. Seuss Enterprises

Dr. Seuss Enterprises is a leading global childrenâs entertainment company focused on promoting literacy, education, self-confidence, and the wonderful possibilities of a childâs imagination through the works of Dr. Seuss. The company was established in 1993 and is based in San Diego, California. Global endeavors include publishing, film, TV, stage productions, exhibitions, digital media, licensed merchandise, and other strategic partnerships. For more information about Dr. Seuss Enterprises, visit DrSeussEnterprises.com, or follow on Instagram.

About Creative Minds Publications

Literacy consultant and author Kathryn Starke founded Creative Minds Publications, an educational publishing and literacy consulting company. Starke is the author of Tackle Reading and A Touchdown in Reading: An Educatorâs Guide to Literacy Instruction. She has helped over 200 elementary schools around the country achieve reading success.

â

New York, NY (February 23, 2023)âOn September 5, 2023, Dr. Seuss Enterprises and Random House Childrenâs Books will publish Dr. Seussâs HOW THE GRINCH LOST CHRISTMAS!, an official sequel to the beloved holiday classic How the Grinch Stole Christmas!, which was originally published in 1957 and has sold nearly 10 million copies in North America alone. With this new story set in Who-ville, readers will finally get to know how the Grinch spent Christmas one year after the events of his big heist and will see if he has truly embraced the spirit of Christmas. The publication was announced today by Judith Haut, EVP, Deputy Publisher, Random House Childrenâs Books, with Susan Brandt, President and CEO, Dr. Seuss Enterprises. The publication will be supported by a major marketing and publicity campaign, including opportunities for fans to interact with the Grinch character around the country.

Dr. Seussâs HOW THE GRINCH LOST CHRISTMAS! marks the first time that Dr. Seuss Enterprises and Random House Childrenâs Books have expanded Dr. Seussâs classic How the Grinch Stole Christmas! narrative. The new story begins one year after the Grinch stole Christmas from Who-ville. Eager to prove to the Whos that his heart has grown to love the holiday, the Grinch devises a plan to win Who-villeâs Christmas Crown by making the largest, most spectacular Christmas tree the Whos have ever seen! When things donât go as planned, the Grinchâs heart turns ice-cold, and he threatens to leave Who-ville for good . . . until one small, special Who reminds him that Christmas is not about winning.

An uplifting follow-up to the timeless tale that has been at the center of Christmas festivities for more than 66 years, HOW THE GRINCH LOST CHRISTMAS! will bring new joy to Seuss fans young and old.

Featuring a foil-enhanced jacket and full-color illustrations rendered in the iconic style of the original, HOW THE GRINCH LOST CHRISTMAS! makes a splendid gift and is a must-have addition to Dr. Seuss libraries everywhere. This is a fully original story, written and illustrated in classic Dr. Seuss style by author Alastair Heim and artist Aristides Ruiz. Heim and Ruiz have contributed to Dr. Seuss publishing over the years, with Heim writing the âby the Cat in the Hatâ books If I Had Your Vote, If I Ran Your School, and If I Were Saint Nick, as well as the board book I Am the Cat in the Hat, and with Ruiz illustrating the Cat in the Hatâs Learning Library books for over two decades.

Says Susan Brandt, President and CEO of Dr. Seuss Enterprises: âHow the Grinch Stole Christmas! is one of the most beloved holiday celebration books of all time. Adding to that legacy with a sequel is a process we have carefully considered, and we love what the author and illustrator have created. We feel it will be yet another heartwarming piece of Seussian literature that will help families around the world grow their hearts three more sizes as they celebrate the holidays for decades to come.â

Says Alice Jonaitis, Executive Editor, Dr. Seuss Publishing: âOne of the most asked questions we receive from Seuss fans of all ages is âWhat do you think happened to the Grinch after he stole Christmas?â We are excited to finally be able to answer this question and have the magic of Grinchmas live on with this new book brought to life by Alastair Heim and Aristides Ruiz.â

How the Grinch Stole Christmas! has become an annual holiday tradition for families and young children around the globe, with three blockbuster movies starring major names, including Jim Carrey and Benedict Cumberbatch, and several other books featuring the Grinch, including the recently published Dr. Seussâs The Sounds of Grinchmas (on sale September 2021), which has already sold 200,000 copies. With 8.6 billion views of #Grinch on TikTok and a record sales year for How the Grinch Stole Christmas! in 2022, the Grinch has never been more popular.

Maria Correa, Associate Editor, edited the project for Random House Childrenâs Books.

Dr. Seussâs HOW THE GRINCH LOST CHRISTMAS! is available for pre-order now.

Dr. Seussâs How the Grinch Lost Christmas!

By Alastair Heim; Illustrated by Aristides Ruiz

Random House Books for Young Readers | On Sale: 9/5/2023 | Ages 5â9 | Page Count: 40

HC ISBN: 978-0-593-56316-8 ($19.99/$26.99 Can.) | GLB: 978-0-593-56317-5 ($22.99/$29.99 Can.)

RANDOM HOUSE CHILDRENâS BOOKS (rhcbooks.com) is the worldâs largest English-language childrenâs trade book publisher. Creating books for toddlers through young adult readers, in all formats from board books to activity books to picture books, novels, ebooks, and apps, the imprints of Random House Childrenâs Books bring together award-winning authors and illustrators, world-famous franchise characters, and multimillion-copy series. Random House is the longtime home of the beloved and bestselling Dr. Seuss books, which continue to make learning to read fun for millions of children everywhere. Random House Childrenâs Books is a division of Penguin Random House LLC.

DR. SEUSS ENTERPRISES is a leading global childrenâs entertainment company focused on promoting literacy, education, self-confidence, and the wonderful possibilities of a childâs imagination through the works of Dr. Seuss. The company was established in 1993 and is based in San Diego, California. Global endeavors include publishing, film, TV, stage productions, exhibitions, digital media, licensed merchandise, and other strategic partnerships. For more information about Dr. Seuss Enterprises, visit drseussenterprises.com or follow on Instagram.

ABOUT ALASTAIR HEIM: Alastair Heim is the author of thirteen childrenâs picture books, including Hello, Door, which was named a New York Public Library Best Book of the Year; The Great Puppy Invasion, which won the Oklahoma Redbud Read-Aloud Award; and Quiet Down, Loud Town!, which was named a Junior Library Guild Gold Standard Selection. He has also written three Dr. Seuss Beginner Books: If I Had Your Vote, If I Ran Your School, and If I Were Saint Nickâall featuring the Cat in the Hatâas well as the board book I Am the Cat in the Hat. He is represented by Kelly Sonnack of the Andrea Brown Literary Agency and lives in Kansas City with his wife and three incredible children.

ABOUT ARISTIDES RUIZ: New Jersey native and âconstant doodlerâ Aristides (âArtâ) Ruiz has illustrated over 100 books for childrenâamong them more than 40 books in the Cat in the Hatâs Learning Library series. A versatile artist, he divides his time between illustrating for children and fine-art painting. To learn more about Art and his work, visit aristidesruiz.com.

â

LOS ANGELES, August 9, 2022 (Newswire.com) - AtGames Â®, a leader in interactive entertainment products, today announced that classic Dr. Seuss properties will be featured in new virtual pinball tables for the AtGames Legends Arcade Family of products running on the Legends Arcade Platform.

â

The Dr. Seuss properties that will be developed into innovative new original virtual pinball tables exclusively for play on Legends Arcade Platform products like the Legends Ultimate, Legends Pinball, and Legends Gamer series include Dr. Seussâs ABC; Fox in Socks; Green Eggs and Ham; How the Grinch Stole Christmas!; Oh, the Places Youâll Go!; One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish; and The Cat in the Hat.

â

âDr. Seuss Enterprises is always looking for best-in-class partners to help bring our iconic characters to life in new, exciting ways," said Susan Brandt, President and CEO of Dr. Seuss Enterprises. "Placing them in the digital pinball space AtGames has created is an exciting blend of nostalgia and innovation, and we look forward to seeing our fans' reaction to this exceptionally engaging platform."

â

This new partnership builds on previous AtGames initiatives that have brought extensive libraries of classic arcade video games and other legendary properties to their range of exciting home arcades and consoles, complete with authentic gameplay, video, and sound.

â

âThese beloved Dr. Seuss properties have delighted families for generations,â says Dr. Ping-Kang Hsiung, CEO of AtGames. âWe are humbled to partner with Dr. Seuss Enterprises on making these virtual pinball tables as memorable as their other iconic media adaptations.

â

The new virtual pinball tables based on iconic Dr. Seuss properties are expected to start to appear on AtGames Legends Arcade Family products in late 2022.

â

About AtGames:

AtGames (http://www.atgames.net) is a leader in innovative consumer-oriented interactive entertainment products. The company leverages the latest technology to develop and publish its best-selling classic video game products for worldwide distribution. AtGames is based in Los Angeles, with international offices in Taipei and Shenzhen.

â
